The Vulcan HL7 FHIR Accelerator aims to bridge research and clinical care through use of FHIR, strategically connecting collaborators to maximize expertise and efforts. The Vulcan Utilizing the Digital Protocol (UDP) project enhances the integration of clinical and translational research with clinical care by enabling digital protocol exchange through FHIR, supporting Vulcan's mission to connect these domains and research integration into care.

This Implementation Guide (IG) allows for FHIR-based exchange of digital clinical trial protocols aligned to ICH M11 (Clinical electronic Structured Harmonized Protocols, or CeSHarP) in a manner compatible across clinical research stakeholders. The specific initial use case address within is exchange between sponsors and regulators, while building foundations for, and avoiding blockers to, additional use cases that benefit the multiple stakeholders who utilize protocol information

The Vulcan UDP project supports Vulcan's mission to connect clinical and translational research to clinical care by enabling digital protocol exchange through FHIR. The main goal of this FHIR Implementation Guide is to concentrate on near-term achievable use cases to ensure immediate impact and feasibility, while building foundations for, and avoiding blockers to, long-term cross-stakeholder compatibility across many additional use cases. Governance requirements include retaining alignment with ICH M11 and compatible standards of CDISC USDM and Controlled Terminology as well as related uses of FHIR such as those in the Evidence Based Medicine (EBM) Implementation Guide.

The initial use case focuses on sponsor-to-regulator exchange of protocols which align to ICH M11, leveraging and enabling compatibility with related standards where possible, and building cross-organization relationships to enable future governance.

While out of scope for this version of the Implementation Guide, the future aim is to develop a use case roadmap, considering the broad spectrum of potential use cases of digital protocols and seeking opportunities to establish foundational connections. (See also the Use Cases & Workflows section).

Detailed governance processes are also out of scope for this version but will be addressed in future iterations. Successful governance will require active participation in HL7 processes to ensure long-term alignment with related efforts such as EBM, and with other organizations, such as ICH M11, CDISC, and TransCelerate.
This FHIR Implementation Guide is organized across the following tabs:
- Home: Provides an orientation outlining objectives, background, and scope
- Guidance: Describes how the technical work was approached and why certain decisions were made
- Use Cases & Workflows: Provides a view to use cases covered in this Implementation Guide as well as those others are working on and future potential use cases across stakeholders
- Implementation Best Practice: Provides considerations for how to leverage this Implementation Guide
There is also a comprehensive Table of Contents to aid navigation across all content.
